description: The premier shipbuilding company in Water 7 and one of the most famous in the world. Founded and led by Iceburg, who also serves as mayor of Water 7. The company operates multiple docks with Dock #1 being the primary facility, staffed by world-class shipwrights.

statusHistory.reason: Galley-La Company is operational and conducting business

keyMoments.title: Showcasing Dock #1 to the Straw Hats
keyMoments.description: Kalifa gives Luffy, Nami, and Usopp an official tour of Galley-La Company's Dock #1, demonstrating the company's world-class facilities and capabilities.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Galley-La Company's prestige and expertise, showing why the Straw Hats sought them out for ship repairs.

keyMoments.title: Diagnosing the Going Merry
keyMoments.description: Kaku, representing Galley-La Company's expertise, delivers the professional assessment that the Going Merry cannot be repaired, even with the company's world-renowned capabilities.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the company's honesty and expertise - they could have taken money for futile repairs but instead give an honest assessment.

description: A group of ship dismantlers and bounty hunters operating in Water 7. They scavenge ships for materials and money while also hunting pirates for bounties. The organization includes at least fifty members and is led by Franky, though he does not appear in this episode.

statusHistory.reason: The Franky Family is actively operating in Water 7

keyMoments.title: Mugging Usopp
keyMoments.description: Members of the Franky Family successfully ambush and rob Usopp, stealing 200 million berries that the Straw Hats needed for ship repairs.
keyMoments.significance: This theft triggers the major conflict of the Water 7 arc, leading to Usopp's guilt, the confrontation at Franky House, and eventually Usopp's departure from the crew.
